description: Change of use from retail shop to A3 take away and installation of fume extraction equipment at the rear
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of five years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | Any machinery audible outside the premises must be designed to satisfy an acoustic standard not exceeding NR35 Leq,5mins, for plant which operate during the period of 2300-0700hrs weekends and anytime on Saturdays, Sundays and Bank Holidays and NR40 Leq,1hr, for plant which is controlled by time switches only to run during the period 0700-2300 hours Mondays to Fridays, measured or calculated at 1m from the nearest facade of the nearest affected noise sensitive premises with all machines running together.  REASON:   In the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties, in accordance with Adopted Unitary Development Plan (UDP) Policies B5, ES5, Replacement UDP Policies 4.1, 4.11. | The hours of operation including deliveries shall be restricted to 8AM to 11PM.  REASON:   In the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of the nearby properties, in accordance with Adopted Unitary Development Plan (UDP) Policy B5, Replacement UDP Policy 4.1. | Details of sound insulation between the ground and the upper floor to satisfy an acoustic criteria of NR25 (Leq,5min), (2300-0700 hours will be met inside a bedroom and NR30 (Leq,1hour), 0700-2300 hours inside a living room when noise is generated from the commercial use must be submitted in writing to and approved by the Local Planning Authority in accordance with approved details.  REASON:   In the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of the above premises, in accordance with Adopted Unitary Development Plan (UDP) Policies B5, B8, Replacement UDP Policies 4.1, 4.11. | The premises shall only be used as a hot food takeaway/restaurant and for no other purpose including a pub, wine bar or any other use within Class A3 of the Schedule to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 without the prior written permission of the Local Planning Authority obtained through the submission of a planning application.  REASON:   To restrict the use of the premises to one compatible with the surrounding area, and to enable the Local Planning Authority to maintain strict control over the nature of the use, in the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties, in accordance with the Council's adopted policy B5 and replacement policy 4.1. | Notwithstanding the information contained in the application details of fume extraction shall be submitted in writing to the Local Planning Authority before the development is occupied. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.  REASON:   In the interest of the living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties and the visual appearance of the area, in accordance with Adopted Unitary Development Plan (UDP) Policies B5, ES6, Replacement UDP Policy 4.1.
